name: Fort Donelson National Battlefield
description: Brigadier General Ulysses S. Grant was becoming quite famous as he wrote these words following the surrender of Confederate Fort Donelson on Sunday, February 16, 1862. The Union victory at Fort Donelson elated the North, and stunned the South. Within days of the surrender, Clarksville and Nashville would fall into Union hands. Grant and his troops had created a pathway to victory for the Union.
shortDescription: Brigadier General Ulysses S. Grant was becoming quite famous as he wrote these words following the surrender of Confederate Fort Donelson on Sunday, February 16, 1862. The Union victory at Fort Donels...

operatingHours.description:
Fort Donelson NB Visitor Center is open daily 8:30 am - 4:00 pm CST.
Dover Hotel hours are 8:30 am - 4:00 pm CST daily.

The park is closed Thanksgiving, December 25, and January 1.  Hours change seasonally.

The park tour route is open:
Spring time change to Memorial Day: 8:00 am to 6:00 pm CDT 
Memorial Day to Labor Day: 8:00 am to 8:00 pm CDT
Labor Day to fall time change: 8:00 am to 6:00 pm CST
Fall time change to spring time change: 8:00 am to 4:30 pm CST

climate.weatherDescription: Fort Donelson National Battlefield traditionally experiences mild to moderate winters and hot summers with an average high of 90 degrees in the summer and 40 in winter; average lows in the winter are 30 degrees but single digits are not unusual. Rainfall in the area averages 53 inches a year with an additional 6 inches of ice/snow and violent thunderstorms can take place at any time of year.

images.title: Fort Donelson National Cemetery
images.caption: The Fort Donelson National Cemetery, final resting place for Soldiers who fell in battle during the Civil War, the Spanish-American War, World War I, and World War II.

images.title: Artillery at Fort Donelson NB
images.caption: Quiet Afternoon overlooking the Cumberland River, Fort Donelson NB

images.title: The Dover Hotel
images.caption: The Dover Hotel, site of the first major Civil War surrender.

images.title: Fort Donelson National Cemetery
images.caption: Fort Donelson National Cemetery: Final resting place for thousands of American Veterans

images.title: Earthworks
images.caption: A view of the earthworks, where Confederate Soldiers once stood watch.
